review: Well, this was a pleasant surprise. I've read some negative reviews of it in comparison to Roku, but decided to get it anyway to watch Amazon Prime offerings.  Some thoughts:- For its main function, access to Amazon Prime, it's neatly perfect. The box operates lighting fast, there is no delay, or queuing when starting to play a video. I can go from power on (from standby) to watching a video in less than 5 seconds - which is impressive.- Remote is excellent for what it does, comfortable and small in hand. The problem is, as it is not backlit, its hard to distinguish the buttons in the dark - I wish they had different shapes or some other cues. After a while it gets easy to adjust to buttons by feel, when using Nav ring as reference.- Voice search is excellent.- I like the box design, tiny and flat, and blends into the background next to equally colored tv.- The power light - that damn thing is so bright at night, I had to cover it up with electrical tape. At the very least the box needs an 'off' switch to turn off that annoyance when i'm done watching. The light does shut off eventually when box goes into standby, but it takes a long time.- Queuing next episode of a show is great too ...- FF/REW are ackward - but a 10sec skip is very handy.- Playback is great with no stutter (5.7mb/s DSL, Wi-Fi)- There does not seem to be a way to restrict searches to Prime only.- I haven't used other media apps, so I can't comment on them.
